Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 115 of the Customs Tariffa, hereby makes the annexed Stranded Steel Wire Remission Order.

Section.Text: Subject to section 2, remission is hereby granted of the customs duties paid or payable under the Customs Tariff in respect of non-alloy steel stranded wire, having a diameter of 5 mm or less, of subheading No. 7312.10, imported into Canada during the period commencing on July 10, 1996, and ending on June 16, 1999, for use in the manufacture of tires.
The remission is granted on condition that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a claim for remission is made to the Minister of National Revenue within two years after the date on which this Order comes into force; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the importer files such evidence as may be required by the Canada Customs and Revenue Agency to determine eligibility for remission.

Section.Text: This Order comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
